titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Kluger Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr. and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 07:38

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, interview notes, and other materials which document Richard Kluger's professional career as a newspaper editor and author.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creator of this collection for materials he has authored or otherwise produced. After the lifetime of the creator, copyright shall become the property of the creator‚Äôs widow. Thereafter, copyright shall pass to their children, or the survivor(s) of them. Upon the death of the last surviving grandchild, copyright shall become the property of Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard Kluger Papers (MS 1443). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related material: Brown vs. the Board of Education Papers (MS 759), Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Kluger was born in Paterson, New Jersey, on September 18, 1934. He graduated from Princeton (B.A.) in 1956. Kluger has written novels and articles, served in editorial capacities for the Wall Street Journal , the New York Post , Forbes magazine, the New York Herald Tribune , Book Week , and Simon and Schuster, and held the position of president and publisher of Charterhouse Books. He authored the Pulitzer Prize winning Ashes to Ashes , a history of the American tobacco industry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, interview notes, and other materials which document Richard Kluger's professional career as a newspaper editor and author.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Folders 534 and 535 in box 45 of Accession 1997-M-023 may not be used without the permission of Richard Kluger.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series and one addition: I. Research and Interview Files. II. Subject Files. III. Topical Files

New York Tribune Inc. & Newspaper Guild of New York: Agreement
"The Law and Freedom at the Press"

odd.head: General
odd.p: Folders 17-19 were removed at the request of the donor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This addition to the Richard Kluger Papers consists of research materials compiled for the preparation of Ashes to Ashes: America's Hundred Year Cigarette War, the Public Health, and the Unabashed Triumph of Philip Morris , 1996. As much as possible, Kluger's folder headings and arrangements have been retained.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Folders 534 and 535 in box 45 may not be used without permission of Richard Kluger.
